Reviews.Title: “Good price / value and great location”
Reviews.Author: nathalieyes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, but nothing special. Its clean, the rooms are pretty small, but with everything you need, and with "wooden style" floors. Breakfast is served in Hotel Gotic just over the street, buffet and good, nothing amazing but again, good value for the price you pay. The location is great - just 5 walking minutes away from the sea, and the ramblas, in the barrio gotic, a metro station just upfront, loads of restaurants and tapas bar in walking distance. You're right in the middle of where you want to be in Barcelona. Which also means that its not very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Christine B
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal - about equal easy walking distance to the port in one direction and Placa de Catalunya (top of Ramblas) in other direction. Breakfast across road at Hotel Gotic was buffet service and catered more to continental taste (lots of meats) and not much choice of hot food, however we still found plenty we could eat and times were good if you want an early start to the day (7am-10.30). Our room for a couple plus one child was to the side of the hotel and faced Hotel Gotic. Room was very spacious, probably used to be an apartment, good-sized bathroom, small lounge leading to 1st bedroom then second bedroom was curtained off from this. Lots of storage space, only English TV channel was news, hotel staff pleasant and helpful. Down sides were noise at night and unpleasant smell coming from sink when it was used - however this may be a general problem in Barcelona as we found the same smell when we ate at an outside restaurant in the Ramblas (!) - and you could safely leave the windows open. Overall I would say it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: hankmail505
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at hotel Suizo. The location is probably one of the best in Barcelona to be able to access every important site as well as great shops, the medevil section, even the beach. The hotel staff is friendly and accomodating. Now the down side (but it's worth working around).The location is very noisy. People tend to hang out in the small plaza in front of the hotel until 2-3 A.M. on a week day night. Traffic is loud all night. Bring ear plugs. Pillows are like cement bags. "jetted tub" was a broken relic. Bring your own toiletries as those the hotel supplies are tiny and very poor quality. No wash cloths. These are minor concerns if your a seasoned traveler, especially given the hotels prime location. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with no amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Cittacentro
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for everything. Tired rooms with minimal bathroom amenities in serious need of refurbishment

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ErrikaGreece
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Suizo hotel. Location is really good, close to most of the sights and has the metro right outside. 5 min walk from the Ramblas, 7-10 min from barceloneta & same from placa Catalunia. Hotel itself is good but most of the rooms do not have the size of the pics given on the site, infact they are smaller. That is no problem though as there are so many things to do and see....you won't get much time to spent in your room. Rooms are very clean and quiet (at least the room WE had was!). Breakfast is very good but you have to go to another hotel oposite Suizo with a card they give you at the reception. The only falsh we saw is that staff at reception are not very pleasant and they do not say "hello" or even look at guest when they walk inside. The only smile we got was when we said goodbye & paid the bill.....oh, well....we still think Barcelona was tooo super to let this bother us. I would stay there again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatF83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 for 3 nights. Good location, walking distance to good tapas bars and also to the main tourist sites. Room was small but clean and not noisy. Price paid for the location was reasonable

Reviews.Title: “good location - but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Alonlif
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 4 night stay at the Suizo. Excellent location - can't get better. But otherwise the hotel is very poor - rooms very small, old looking. The room was clean which was good - but the bed covers were old and torn at some parts. I paid a lot - because of the MWC show, but other wise i'm guessing prices are very reasonable. You can also expect some noise from the street bellow. So if location is most important, and you want to keep it cheap - go for it. but come with very low expectations for all the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near everything”
Reviews.Author: vicecache
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights Room were nice and clean with bigger bathroom than expected from what we have seen so far in Spain. nice gizmo, your room card plugs in a receptacle which keeps the electricity supply in the room. If you leave with the card the room powers off. We choose breakfast with our room ( extra $6) well worth it.The breakfast is selve served and there is a wide choices and lots of it.For breakfast you have to walk to a different hotel , about a 30 second walk just across the street. The TV is spanish with some french channnel which for a reason unknown to me had a much lower volume than regular spanish program. The noise level near this hotel can be high at time since its a corner of the main street and the entrance to the metro all kinds of people can hang-out at all time of days.If you are a light spleeper , a set of ear plugs are always handy. No bad surprises

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location, will definately go there again.”
Reviews.Author: lilo o
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. I stayed there for five days.The hotel has a great location that will enables you to discover the Gothic quarter of Barcelona and not get too far from the hotel. It is also a three-minute walk from the famous la Rambla street, and the metro station is just in front of the hotel, which is kind of perfect 'cause I used the metro frequently to get around Barcelona. The rooms are clean and spacious, which I found remarkable since most of the hotels' rooms across Europe, and specially in pairs, are so small. The staff were friendly and so helpful. Breakfast was served at another hotel around the corner; and I got to admit that the breakfast was tasty and included many options to suit everyone's own taste. There was no mini-bar in our room, however, there was a vending machine in the first floor where you could get snacks and drinks. For a three-star hotel, Suizo hotel is definitely worth the money but more importantly, worth your stay. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sdmNewcastleUponTyne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location in the Gothic quarter near the Cathedral. We usually stay in a four star hotel across the road but found this to be perfectly adequate and cheaper. The room was very clean if a little dated but the maids cleaned every day and replaced toiletries. The hotel staff spoke very good english and we found them to be very helpful. The breakfast was taken at their sister hotel and had a good choice of cereal, fruit, croissants and pastries. The coffee machine was excellent and again the staff were very helpful. The hotel is very good for the restaurants and bars in the Gothic area and our favourite tapas bar was La Luna very good music and the tapas is reasonably priced. As mentioned by other people the hotel is on a busy road and is noisy but we found it ok and slept well. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “solid 2-star accommodations, don't expect too many (good) things”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is noisy from the Laietana street that runs just in front of it (and the subway entrance), but I sort of expected that and that's what happens in a big city like Barcelona. The room was very basic and small, the heating system provided barely enough heat (it was enough, though). One unpleasant surprise was a charge of 2 Euros/day for the safe box. Another unpleasant surprise was when I discovered that the safe box was not solidly attached to anything and could be picked up (and taken away, and later opened in the comfort of one's garage) by a reasonably strong person. Another unpleasant experience was at checkout, when the hotel clerk tried to stiff us for a lousy 2 Euros, by claiming that we had used the safe for 8 days instead of the 7 hotel days (nights) we had spent there, and tried to explain to us that the first hours of the first night and the first hours of the last day counted as full days as far as the safe was concerned (lame, very lame). Also, the maids started their knocking on doors well before midday, but we once returned to the room at about 3 pm and the room hadn't been made (the maid was in the hallway taking her time talking on her cell phone). Also, almost any piece of information we got from the hotel's reception desk was unreliable (regarding transportation to the airport - they recommended the unsafe metro vs. a very good airport bus, as the cheaper alternative to taking a taxi; they didn't know - or pretended they didn't know - where everybody was heading for the New Year's Eve celebration - Placa Catalunya, for God's sake, we had to find that out ourselves by walking around town for a couple of hours). Not a very good hotel, I would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kmjfin
Reviews.Content: The upside for this hotel is definitely it's central location in Gothic Quarter and closeness to La Rambla and the tube. And this can make it really good value for your money. Rooms were really tight and look dated, ours was 2nd floor facing the side street which made it quite impossible to get a good night sleep due to various noises outside. So if you are a light sleeper, bring your earplugs! Breakfast was served across the street in another (sister) hotel and was quite basic, especially fruits were missing. Service in general was good, staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: LindaGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suizo had everything you'd expect from a 3-star hotel. Our room was simple and on the small side, but we didn't mind as it was well kept and clean. Nice spacious bathroom. Air con / heater. Breakfast was taken at the neighbouring hotel (a 4-star hotel, which meant a 4-star breakfast buffet). The staff were nice and helpful and their English good enough. The best thing about the hotel was the location; right by a square and metro. In the heart of the gothic quarter and very close to La Rambla, the Picasso museum and beautiful Parc de la Ciutadella. There were large and well crowded streets surrounding the hotel, which felt safe in a city like Barcelona. Lots of nice restaurants close by (try the pinchos and cava at Sagardi, the paella at Farran and a pint at Dunne's). The bakery right next to the hotel makes delicious lemon meringue to satisfy any sweet tooth. I'll stay here again when returning to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in heart of Barri Gotic.”
Reviews.Author: marlette
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a room with balcony, facing Plaze de'l Angel. Take note, Barcelona NEVER sleeps, and we were in the thick of all the activities. If you are a light sleeper or bothered by noise, do not book an outside room. If you can sleep with ear plugs, this is the perfect hotel to stay in. The balcony became our dining room a number of nights, and we had a wonderful time watching Barcelona social scene. Room in spacious. Bathroom good sized. Would recommend this to friends [but warn them about the noise].

Reviews.Title: “Great location; property not so great”
Reviews.Author: 305ht
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, but the rooms are small and impractical, staff is indifferent, hallways dark and old fashioned. The safe is in a dark, unreachable corner of the wardrobe, and you have to pay 1 euro/day for it. The shower had a hook to hold it on the wall, but ir was broken. Weekend nights are very noisy, with rowdy returning guests and lots of noisy street. The place has not been kept up, and it's a shame. It could be really nice. I question the *** rating.

Reviews.Title: “first class stay”
Reviews.Author: martyn95
Reviews.Content: Hi just returned from our stay at the Suizo hotel in Barcelona we stayed for 7 nights, after reading some of the reviews we were a little unsure about this hotel but i can tell you you have nothing to worry about the hotel staff were very friendly the room was very clean we had a balcony which over looked one of the side streets which could get a little noisey but you soon got used to it we had no problem at all. The breakfast which we had to cross the road to the gotic hotel 2 mins was very good the normal cheese ham, bread,cereals fruit and hot sausage bacon etc very good. The location of the Hotel was first class right in the middle of the city 10min walk to the Rambles 20min walk to the beach and port veil and may shops cafe's and bars,The metro is right out side the front door and is so easy to use.so don't be put off by the reveiws you read try it for yourselfs.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: urlaub2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 wonderful stays at this hotel in the center of the gothic quater. I really love this hotel - little comfort but great location and helpful staff. The rooms are small and you can hear nois from the street, but you location is great and after a few mojito ... ;-) I never book a breakfast-rate because there are lots of bars around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: MBNF120
Reviews.Content: We just came back from five days in Barcelona, and couldn't have had a better location! We loved exploring all the alleys in the Gothic quarter, and were within walking distance to the Ramblas, and Catalunya Square where most of the tours left from. We were also close to the port and the Acquarium. Our very unreliable travel agent assured us that there was a minibar, as we needed refrigeration for medication--but when we got to the hotel, there was none. When we explained our problem to the reception, they immediately offered to keep our things in the hotel refrigerator. There was never a problem to retrieve them day or night. THAT'S SERVICE!!! The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms a bit small, and a bit noisy--but we had a wonderful stay and would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Only has it's location going for it.”
Reviews.Author: kayc_travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Staff really unhelpful and lethargic. Booked a twin room which was two single beds pushed together. Website boasted wifi throughout the hotel but failed to mention it was 24 euros per day to use!! Room overlooked the main street which was really really noisy especially at night. However, the metro station was right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: aprilkiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Suizo hotel for 6 nights for my sightseeing in Barcelona. I checked in 31th of January and the room was horribly cold. After two cold nights, my lab-top broke into two pieces while i was out. I told the receptionists that it was broken while I was gone and one of them keep saying that they didn't see any labtop in my room. It was outrageous!!!! The "manager" who was more likely genitor or a super I met the next morning said that I need a police report for claiming insurance money. I went to the police station during my precious moment of sightseeing only to find out it was totally unnecessary. Broken ladtop was a mistake the hotel made it was not a crime after all, the police said. I came back to hotel and talked with the assistand manager who was slightly more reasonable compare to the manager and he gave me this "complain form" for claiming insurance money. After 2 nights the broken ladtop occurred!!! I finally filled the form and handed in to the hotel and came back to Korea and handed in another piece to my travel agent but sill, not quite sure whether i would be paid for my damage or not. During the whole stay, none of them in the hotel, the maid, receptionist whose Engligh was too poor to work at reception, the manager, the assistant manager said a word of apology for my damage. The broken labtip ruined my trip entirely since I had to write a journal every night. i had to use paper and pen. I really wanted to move to another hotel but it was all booked and prepaid and i didn't want to waste more money in Barcelona. This hotel is located in Gotic so the location was ok but I had to go to other building for breakfast. it was inconvenient. The wi-fi was not free they charge 12 euro for 24 hours. I found hair which was not mine, in towel almost everyday. disgusting! I would never recommand this hotel to anyone and who ever wants to stay in Barcelona, this hotel definitely should be the last resort. I couldn't get enough information about the hotel before I leave, so I brought back with an unpleasant memories. I wish no other travelers gets harmed.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Marassa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the Gothic Quarter which is its main asset. We walked in with no reservation and got a room on the top floor with a kind of a porthole in the ceiling for window. When it was 'open', it let in a bit of air and more than enough street noise. Needless to say, there was no view. The AC was too noisy to use at night. The 'double bed' consisted of two single beds that kept sliding apart. There was no mini-bar in the room. No parking, a public inderground parking across the street cost 25 euro a day. When I went to the bathroom at night I was kind of surprised to see the floor swarming with ants, the ants seemed as surprised to see me as I was to see them. Nevertheless, not that bad a place to stay right in the Gothic Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: LondonJAHone
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 6 nights at the Suizo. The room was very clean but there were long black hairs on top of the bed and one inside the bed. The bed itself was the worst bit as it sunk in the middle and was very uncomfortable. Sheets and towels are old and stained. The location is good but it is very noisy, even with the windows shut. The A/C did not work (only seemed to heat the room up) so the room became very airless. After witnessing 2 robberies outside the hotel during the first two days, we decided to use the safe in our room. We were informed by reception that it would cost us 2euro per day for the use of the key to the safe! Clearly the hotel is taking advantage of the situation. After getting pickpocketed on the third day, I phoned the hotel to inform them that the room key card had been stolen. The reception desk could not seem to understand that I wanted the room key cancelled so that no one could use it to get in our room. I was told that I'd have to wait until 4pm for help with that. In frustration, I got a Spanish speaker to intervene and sort it out. The hotel has no wifi. The fairly unhelpful reception informed us that any restaurant up the road would have it but was unable to direct us to anywhere specific. Basically just fobbed us off. Although the location was good, there are many hotels in this area. I would look somewhere else next time. The general feeling in this hotel is to give as little as possible for the money and to take advantage of the guest by charging for the use of the safe in your own room.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for..Budget with good location!”
Reviews.Author: Elli_08
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but its totally OK hotel. The rooms are not in the best condition but we didn´t matter.. We had a room with two beds, bathroom and a french balcony. I had to use earpluggs to sleep because the little street got noisy at night. We loved the location and the room prize wasn´t so much. Near the metro and many Restaurants and Cafe. So spend your money on the good spanish food instead and stay less fancy in the Gotic quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missy_Finland
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. The hotel is in the Barri Gòtic and in front of the hotel is a metro stop. The hotel is surrounded by many attractions, cafes and shops. The rooms are spacious and have a safe . Downsides: Shower water pressure is low and you can hear outside noises in the room also at nights. Breakfast is served at the hotel next door.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have no windows and ice cold showers”
Reviews.Author: Magnetic_Travels
Reviews.Content: As a lot of the previous reviews say, the rooms on the 5th floor have no windows and are very dark. It was very cold when we went to Barcelona and the Heating (AC) was not working and the showers were ice cold. When we asked reception to fix it, they didnt have a clue themselves how to fix it. We read the reviews before we booked this and thought with luck we might not get the rooms with no windows...but we did and it really was a pain. We also booked with friends and they were "upgraded" to a better hotel as our one was overbooked. So it was also bad that our friends were in another hotel when we wanted to be together. The hotel is clean enough and location is great. Its ok just to crash your head at night. But I do like a room to have character and WINDOWS. The rooms were very out of date and the hotel needs to be upgraded. So its why I gave it such a low grade. Its a shame as this hotel with its location has a lot of potential to be great if somebody would only give it the care and attention it needs to upgrade it. If you are going to stay here, maybe paying the extra for a room, will mean you have a nice room not on the 5th floor and with windows

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: SazSally
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay in Hotel Suizo and I Really enjoyed my stay there! I was very apprenhensive before staying there due to the reviews I read but I was plesantly surprised!!! My boyfriend and I were like to kids at christmas waiting to hear what floor we were on because of the reviews we read about the top floor rooms. We ended up on the third floor and first impressions were very pleasant. The room and bathroom were spotless and there were nice little goodies such as a mini sewing kit, Shoe shine and a comb ( which I ended up using for the whole holiday @bag friendly :) ) Our room was on the left hand side of the hotel facing onto other windows which did not bother me atal!! I found the staff helpful and friendly! It was really close to all the main attractions and i recommend taking a walk down to Port Vell as it is stunning and there is just a great atmosphere down there!! The rambla is also less than a 5 minite walk away! Also the metro stop is directly outside the door! From the airport you should get a return bus ticket to placa de catalunya and from there get the red metro to uriquonao (cant spell) and swop there to the yellow metro to jaume1! We also got the tour bus (bus touristic) which was 26euro for 2 days and it was well worth every penny and in the evening we would get the red bus which stops off near hotel suizo to freshen up to go for a meal!! WATCH OUT for young spanish people coming up to you in groups of 3 or 5 who will pretend to be collecting for handicapped people while they pick pocket you!! I nearly got caught in this trap as they would crowd around you!! Finally enjoy your holiday as barcelona is a gorgeous city to visit and I would definately recommend Hotel Suizo especially for people on a budget!! Its perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hotel, Loved the Area”
Reviews.Author: Nic8877
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in a great location, I would NOT recommend staying here. Not only is the hotel very old, but the rooms are pretty terrible - they're either too small with no windows or they have no working AC if they have a balcony. The staff was unresponsive to problems we had and overall just unhelpful and rude. For a future trip to Barcelona, I would be happy to pay a bit more to stay anywhere better!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ave2007
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal with this hotel and after reading the reviews I was a bit nervous but it was a really pleasant experience. the hotel is situated less than 5 mins from la ramblas and the port area. Our room was old fashioned enough but with all the trimmings you would expect a tv, phone, mini bar, safe, hair dry and nice bath with powerful shower. The beds were really comfy and we had a balcony that looked onto a busy street. I would say if you have children this is not the hotel for you as its very noisy at night . Barcelona enjoys a rather particular reputation for its night life. there are many small cafes and boutiques nearby but dont eat in cappacino cafe chain they charged us 11 euros for two cheese sandwiches and two cokes. for good value and a safe central location this is a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ssibayan
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location, 10-minute walk to Las Ramblas, literally one step outside the metro stop. - Nice view, we had a corner room with three floor-to-ceiling window-doors that opened into small balconies. We paid the cheapest price that we could find (75 euro) and didn't request it or anything. Cons: - Requested a double bed, the best they could do was push two single beds together. - Hot water in shower went from normal to scorching hot... every 6 seconds or so. It was like clockwork. - Heater in room did not work. - Staff was borderline rude. I have never been to a hotel where every single employee I talked to made me feel like they hated being there and didn't want me to be there either. The quality of the room was vastly better than a hostel, but overall the experience was incredibly disappointing compared to other hotels. I would only recommend this to someone who is deciding between this or a hostel. I have stayed in some hostels in Barcelona, and this was a little bit better, for a comparable price if you have 2 or 3 people. To get to the hotel from the airport, I followed a previous Tripadvisor's post, it was very easy: Take the Blue city bus from the airport to the Placa Catalunya. It cost around 3.50 euro per person. The Placa Catalunya is the first stop on the bus, and the driver didn't call it out or anything, so be ready to get off. Take the Metro to the Jaume I stop, it is on the yellow L4 line. It is literally right outside the metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel at an very good price”
Reviews.Author: Woozle00
Reviews.Content: We won some free flights to Barcelona, but had to go just before Christmas and book at somewhere cheapish at short notice. Suizo came up on a web search as having rooms available - easily the cheapest 3-star, so we booked it with some trepidation. We needn't have worried. It was fine for a cheap 3-night break. Plus points: - Almost perfect location. 5 mins from Ramblas, Cathedral, Christmas market, Little alleys with shops restaurants etc. - Clean. Friendly staff. I think we got the room in the photo on the website, so it was what we expected! Minus points: - Noisy at night. To be expected given the location, but double glazing would have helped

Reviews.Title: “Great location but top floor rooms are bad.”
Reviews.Author: Trevelexpert
Reviews.Content: We got two rooms in the top floor, which is basically the loft. The rooms were very uncomfortable, very hot even in October. No ventilation and virtually no natural light. Even the room lights were so dim, one could not read anything. We paid a good price for 2 nights for 2 rooms and the hotel would not even change the rooms when we explained how uncomfortable it was. Otherwise, in terms of location, its tops. Very near everything and great choice of good places to eat. The passages, bathroom (though small and outdated), common areas, lift etc were all good. This is one hotel where we will think twice if we wanted to stay when we visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacant1uk
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel very clean, pleasant staff. Centrally placed for most attractions

Reviews.Title: “Good placed and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: candid_s
Reviews.Content: My wife and me ( around 30 years old both of us ) stayed there for 3 nights. It got all you expect from 3-stars hotel. Clean room and bathroom, but air-conditioner in the room wasn't working. We were offered another room ( but only for 2 last nights since the hotel was full ). You have to close the windows at night because of noise. There is metro station 20meter from the entrance to hotel and a few coffee shops. Generally it's placed close to big street so you got all kinds of noise that can be tolerated ( and one can get a fair sleep ) only when room's windows are closed. Breakfast ( given in hotel 40m from SUIZO ) is very good. especially choice of hams. I found no parking ( but wasn't looking very close because we rented car only after check-out ), but if you need taxi - hotel staff menage it very fast and the car can get right to the entrance - it's handy when you have a heavy luggage. Do not forget that you stay in Suizo in order to explore the wonderfully pretty Barcelona and when you came back to hotel - they have all you need - clean bed and breakfast next morning. The hotel is in a very good location for exploring the city - metro station is next to entrance and RAMBLA, Port and other things are in 500 or so meters from there. We went to see a local dance show in Music House ( nice red house around 250 meters from there ) but didn't like it - it was "tourist show" and 60euro for 2 people wasn't worth it. The staff was Ok and always ready to help. So - if you came to explore Barcelona - Suizo is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...takes a couple of nights to sleep !”
Reviews.Author: Crazyk99
Reviews.Content: The Suizo is in a fantastic location, the entrance to Jaume tube station is quite literally 15 feet outside the Hotel entrance, La Ramblas is a five minute walk up the street by the hotel (either side) the marina is a five minute walk out the entrance and turn right. The hotel was clean and comfy, the only English channel on the TV was some BBC channel (can't recall which as it was a year ago since we went) which basically repeated the same programmes over and over (documentaries / news etc.) but...you don't go to Barcelona to watch TV. Our room was at the front of the hotel, more or less central, two floors up, great for people watching! The only downside was that due to the single glazing the noise outside was very noticeable and it took me a couple of nights before I got a full nights sleep, but you get what you pay for and we didn't pay a lot (don't take that the wrong way, the hotel is great!) The staff were very helpful and friendly, especially taking into account our very poor Spanish, their English was much better! Next door to the hotel is a pastry shop selling all sorts of delicious pastries and other bits'n' bobs, just the place if you like a sweet breakfast! All in all, if you are on a budget ( not sure what the prices are like in season) this is a great, well located, basic but comfy hotel and I'd recommend it. (I'm going to read everyone elses reviews now to see if they agree!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: christineGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! Walking distance to the Cathedral, the gothic quarter, la ramba, and a 15 min walk to the peir at barcelonetta. The metro station is literally 10 steps from the front door of the hotel. Rooms are clean and adequate - what you would expect for the price. Can be quite noisy at night as right in the centre, we slept through it though so not a problem. Would defintely recommend this hotel, especially if you are away for the weekend and won't be spending much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: WestOzgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the gothic quarter. It is close to some interesting small shops, and is a short walk from the Barcelona Cathedral and Plaza Catalunya. Unfortunately the room itself left a lot to be desired. It was incredibly stuffy, with a musty damp smell to it, and although I managed to open the ceiling window, I couldn't get any fresh air in. When the bellboy came to try and turn on the air conditioning at my request, there was no control pad to be found anywhere in the room. I had to swelter all night long, and I was so glad to check out in the morning, just to breathe some fresh air. The photos posted of the hotel rooms, were no reflection at all of the room I stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place!”
Reviews.Author: ALIEN-EYE
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine wanted to come to Barcelona and I recommended this hotel based on its location and its lobby. But the room was terrible: dirty, smelly, ugly and small. I've seen best hotels (at a third of the price) in the worst neighbourhoods of Fez, Morocco, or in Argentina. This people of Hotel Suizo keep scamming people who come to Barcelona. I wonder how they got the 3-star rating or who they bribe to do it. Stay away from this hotel unless you want to have a terror vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: FrogsAndNewts
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who lives nearby and thought the hotel lobby looked decent. Indeed, the lobby looked just fine. The room, however, was atrocious. One small, dirty window on the slanted ceiling the shade of which would not budge. Despite having no real window and being on the top (5th) floor, the street noise, including shouting, garbage trucks and breaking glass, continued throughout the night. In addition, there was a noise something like an electronic buzzing (imagine your neighbor vacuuming in short bursts) every three to seven seconds (I counted) ALL night long. I did not sleep a wink in this hotel. The shower, well, rust stains don't even begin to describe. I stayed one night. Upon checking out, the "bilingual" desk clerk could not work my credit card and could only bark out the words "you pay cash!" When I inquired how to get a taxi he told me it would take 1/2 hour. His colleague overheard and called one which arrived in slightly less than two minutes. Despicable hotel. Wish I could put a sign on the door to warn potential guests to run, run away.
